newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Swiss bond market closing report.
newsitem.headline: Swiss bond market closing report.

text.p: Swiss bonds closed firm, but just off highs, with the market losing steam after the Swiss franc reversed some early gains.
Traders said the market lacked conviction despite its firmer tone and some were watching the German Bund contract to see if it could maintain levels above 100.00.

"The Bund is crucial. If it goes under 100 then we will see a sellout in our markets," said one chief dealer at a large Swiss bank. The cash Conf/Bund spread remained relatively narrow below 200 basis points YLDS3. Traders said prices were helped by short-covering, with some even seeing a mild squeeze.
The market was mainly watching the Swiss franc, which recovered against the dollar and mark. Traders expected any further declines in the currency to push prices lower again.
The dollar rose to 1.2850 francs on Wednesday, its highest levels since February 1995, and the mark rose to 84.32 centimes, its highest levels since March 1995.
The dollar ended Thursday at 1.2710, and the mark at 84.08.
The Swiss National Bank (SNB), as expected, left its discount rate unchanged at 1.00 percent at its weekly meeting.
SNB chairman Hans Meyer is due to speak this evening in Olten, Switzerland at 1800 GMT.
Dec Conf futures CONFZ6 up 27 points at 114.70.
Dec Comi medium-term bond COMIZ6 up 16 points at 110.05.
Mar Euro Swiss francs FESM7 up seven points at 97.93.
4-1/2 Apr 2006 bond CH061893= 104.44 pct, tyld 3.911 pct
